Progress Marker: Members of CF community groups are working in a collaborative effort, listening to different opinions, and taking decisions together.
People outside the CF groups are asking for more information about the movement.
Members of CF community groups are praying for God’s direction and blessing to fulfil the LCI outcomes.
Local members of the movement are contributing a proportion of production costs.
Local members of the movement are contributing to the honorarium for CFs.
Local Christian leaders who used to be sceptical have embraced the movement and want to involve their people in the movement activities.

Different churches, NGOs and community groups have come together in a network meeting / joint event / language conference for a collaborative effort using the mother tongue. They have made some collective decisions.
Different churches, NGOs and community groups are sharing human resources, materials and funds to help each other fulfil the LCI outcomes.
Local Christian leaders from different churches are praying in unity for God’s direction and blessing to fulfil the LCI outcomes.
Local church or community leaders outside of the lead agency are involved in and directly influencing the lead agency annual planning and budgeting process.
Other agencies (Church, NGO or Government) are asking for more information regarding mother tongue based community transformation.
Local Christian leaders are facilitating network meetings without lead agency funds or prompting, which help to fulfil the LCI outcomes.
When there is a disunity or a crisis of confidence within the movement, local members of the movement identify the issue and resolve it together.
Other agencies (Church, NGO or Government) are planning and budgeting for mother tongue based community transformation.
Members of CF community groups use participatory tools (cause and effect tree*, force field analysis*, etc.).  They analyse their situation and plan together how to bring social development.
